item.title: Borderlands 3: Best SDUs to Unlock First
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Backpack SDUs
  • Bank SDUs
  • Assault Rifle And SMG SDUs
  • Grenade And Lost Loot SDUs
  • Shotgun And Sniper Rifle SDUs
  • Pistol SDUs
  • Heavy Weapon SDUs

Storage Deck Upgrades (SDUs) determine the number of items and ammo you can carry in Borderlands 3 . However, they are extremely expensive! They start out fairly cheap, but triple in cost with every upgrade. Hence, maxing out an SDU means spending millions of Borderlands dollars.

With several types of SDUs available for purchase, and not enough money to go around, your best course of action is to know which SDUs net the most value. Your final objective should, of course, be to max out every SDU in the game, but here are the ones you should unlock first.

SDUs can be purchased from Marcus' Munitions Store on the upper level of Sanctuary III. He becomes available after you have completed the first few missions of the main campaign. However, once you beat Borderlands 3 , you can create a new max-level character that skips the tutorial section.

Backpack SDUs

Become a Loot Hoarder

Maxing out backpack SDUs should be your first priority in Borderlands 3 . They increase your inventory space, allowing you to carry more weapons, mods, and other items during missions. Like every other Borderlands game; the more loot you can carry, the more you can sell at vending machines for money to buy more SDUs. This is how you farm a ton of money in BL3 . If you are not looting and selling first at the start of your playthrough, you will have a hard time unlocking all the upgrades by the time you reach the end-game missions.

Bank SDUs

Share Your Loot Between Characters

While new players might ignore purchasing bank SDUs for some of the other upgrades, increasing your bank slots should always be an important priority. They allow you to store more items in the bank vault, becoming a secondary backpack shared between all characters on the same account. If you find a legendary weapon for Amara while playing as Zane, for example, you can save it in the bank for your second BL3 playthrough.

Bank SDUs are the only upgrades that carry over to new characters. The other SDUs must be purchased all over again for every new playthrough.

Assault Rifle And SMG SDUs

Feed Your ARs and SMGs

Most end-game builds in Borderlands 3 rely on assault rifles and submachine guns to shred enemies. Both weapon types have increased fire rates and often end up with weapon mods that consume multiple ammo per shot. Hence, they can easily eat through ammunition, especially against Mayhem 10 enemies and bosses that do not go down easily.

Unlock as many assault rifle and SMG SDUs as possible to ensure your Vault Hunter never runs out of bullets in BL3 .

Grenade And Lost Loot SDUs

Boost Your Early-Mid Game

Borderlands 3 allows you to equip various augmentations to change how your action skill behaves. However, it can take around 30–40 hours to advance two skill trees for your favorite action skill augments. Therefore, for the first dozen or so hours, you have no choice but to rely on your grenades.

Do not take them lightly though. Grenades come with their own mods and do massive explosive damage. Some special grenades can clear whole groups of enemies. They are also useful for specific characters. For example, Zane's Digi-Clone action skill consumes grenades to boost your damage, health, fire rate, reload speed, and skill duration. Investing in some grenade SDUs early on can help you maintain that buff multiple times during a fight.

As for increasing the number of items you get from the Lost Loot vending machine, its priority level remains the same as grenades. Take the first few levels, but do not go overboard. Having some weapons to sell for extra cash every time you return to Sanctuary is fine for the main campaign.

Shotgun And Sniper Rifle SDUs

For When You Take It Personally

Unless you mod your Borderlands 3 experience, shotguns and sniper rifles will always have the lowest ammo capacity. Since they are single-shot weapons, easily overshadowed by other weapon types when pitted against enemy swarms, you might not find it overly important to carry more ammo for either your shotgun or sniper rifle. That said, they also pack the most punch in the game, doing some of the highest damage with head-ripping, body-dismembering shots.

Shotguns are especially great against Maliwan troopers. You might even want to build your Vault Hunter around legendary shotguns like the Doom-inspired Hellwalker. Snipers, on the other hand, can destroy enemies with a critical headshot. They can even be lethal against armored bosses, especially if you roll mods that let you handle a sniper rifle like an assault rifle with insane fire rates.

However, that all means you need to have enough ammo in your backpack. As such, do not shy away from spending your hard-earned dollars on the first six or seven levels of shotgun and sniper rifle SDUs.

Pistol SDUs

Just Enough Clips for a Wild West Shootout

Pistols are one of the most versatile weapons in Borderlands 3 . Depending on your preferred BL3 weapon manufacturer, your favorite pistol can pop heads like a sniper rifle, blast faces at close range, or pepper enemies like a mini-SMG. You will likely never run out of bullets, especially if you aim for precision with a Jakobs pistol. The ones from Maliwan, however, can consume a whole clip for each enemy. Hence, take some pistol SDUs as needed. This can be considered a higher priority depending on how you are building your character.

Heavy Weapon SDUs

Send Explosive Airmails

The rocket launcher is pretty underwhelming until you reach Mayhem's versions of the Plaguebearer or Backburner. The rocket launcher also pairs well with Moze's splash damage skills. Its highly situational usage makes heavy weapon SDUs one of the lowest priorities in Borderlands 3 .

item.title: 20 Must-Play Metroidvania Games in 2024
item.description: If you're still looking to scratch that Metroidvania itch in 2024, then look no further than this list by Joel RPG covering the best must-play games in the genre.

item.title: Fallout 76 Season 18 Community Calendar Explained
item.description:
Fallout 76 ’s Milepost Zero update releases on September 3, 2024, also kicking off Season 18, full of new Scoreboard rewards and events. The various events that will occur throughout Season 18 have already been revealed via Fallout 76 ’s Season 18 Community Events Calendar.

Some of the upcoming events in Season 18 of Fallout 76 are fairly self-explanatory, but some events warrant an explanation. Given the newfound popularity Fallout 76 gained after the Fallout show, there’s likely a large group of players who might be experiencing some of these events for the first time.

What's On Fallout 76’s Season 18 Community Calendar?

Double Mutations

Double Mutations refers to Fallout 76 ’s Daily Ops activity. During this event, there will be two additional difficulty modifiers active in Daily Ops. Meanwhile, certain rewards from this activity will also be doubled.

Mutated Public Events

With Fallout 76 ’s recent push to put Seasonal events into rotation more frequently, Mutated Public Events have become a rarity. However, in Season 18, there will be one full week of this event occurring every month. During Mutated Public Events week, every Public Event in Fallout 76 that occurs at the beginning of the hour will feature Mutations modifiers like the ones found in Daily Ops, and upon completion, these will earn players a special Mutated Package loot bag.

If three or more players at a Mutated Public Event have a Fallout 1st subscription , the event will reward a Mutated Party Pack with better rewards than the Mutated Packages.

Spooky CAMP Competition

This event will be a community contest held on Bethesda’s official Discord server, for whoever can build the best Halloween-themed CAMPs in Fallout 76 . In the past, players who won this competition have earned premium Atoms currency to spend in Fallout 76 ’s Atomic Shop.

Holiday Scorched, Spooky Scorched, and Trick or Treat Event

During the Holiday Scorched and Spooky Scorched events, players can hunt down Scorched wearing festive Christmas or Halloween costumes for themed loot bags. These special Scorched can be found at any location where Scorched normally spawn around Fallout 76 ’s Appalachian wasteland.

For the Trick or Treat event, players can grab a free candy bowl from the Atomic Shop for their CAMP to give out candy earned from the Spooky Scorched loot bags. Then, for the Holiday Scorched event, craftable versions of the Holiday loot bags can be purchased from NPC vendors, and there will also be a Collectron that passively collects Holliday loot bags when placed in a CAMP or Workshop in Fallout 76 .

Fallout Day

Not to be confused with the franchise’s birthday, Fallout Day marks the day that the bombs dropped, starting and ending the Great War in the Fallout franchise timeline on a single day, October 23, 2077. Players can likely expect sales from the Fallout franchise games on most platforms.

Treasure Hunter Weekends

Treasure Hunter Weekends are another event where players will be hunting down enemies across the wasteland for a special loot bag, this time it will be a unique mole miner variant. These treasure hunter mole miners have a chance of spawning at most outdoor locations with other enemies, regardless of whether mole miners naturally spawn there. Craftable versions of mole miners' treasure pails can also be purchased from NPC vendors.

Invaders From Beyond

At the beginning of every hour during this event, the Invaders From Beyond Public Event featuring Fallout ’s famous Zeta aliens will occur in one of many locations across the map. This event is one of the hardest combat encounters in Fallout 76 , so players will want to bring out their best gear along with plenty of ammo, stimpaks, and friends to claim the rewards from this event.

Fallout 76’s Birthday

Fallout 76 will be turning six years old on November 14, 2024, Happy Birthday Fallout 76 ! In the past, this event has included various birthday-themed bundles in the Atomic Shop, a trial for a free Fallout 1st subscription, as well as in-game challenges that players can complete for exclusive rewards.

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Fans Have 1 Big Complaint About the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Fans of Black Myth: Wukong are criticizing the game's level design, particularly in later chapters.
  • Gamers find the Pagoda Prison section frustrating due to health loss and unfair mechanics.
  • Invisible walls and a downgrade in quality in Chapter 3 are common complaints among players.

Black Myth: Wukong players are voicing their one main complaint about the game, with many gamers sharing the same sentiment about a big problem in Game Science's action RPG. This is a complaint that has been leveled at Black Myth: Wukong before, so some fans may not be surprised to see it brought up again.

Inspired by the classical Chinese novel Journey to the West , Black Myth: Wukong launched to solid reviews last month. It also proved a massive commercial success, breaking single-player game records for concurrent players on Steam. Black Myth: Wukong 's fascinating setting immediately drew in gamers, and the heavy Soulslike elements made it extremely rewarding to progress through. Despite this, the game wasn't perfect, with even the most ardent of fans finding something they didn't love about Black Myth: Wukong .

A Reddit thread started by user AutomaticTap3004 details why they feel the level design in Black Myth: Wukong is hugely flawed. While they believe the first two chapters of Black Myth: Wukong are fine, it all goes downhill from Chapter 3 onwards. Their big complaint comes in the Pagoda Prison, where they claim that "Having my heath cut and essentially having to avoid enemies in order to get to the top in order to stop it is just not fun." This is compounded by the fact that "this area has ledges you can fall off of and die from, which wouldn’t be a big deal except for the fact we couldn’t fall off of high places in the game until now."

Black Myth: Wukong Fans Don't Love the Level Design

Many gamers in the thread agreed, sharing their frustration that even constructive criticism is often shut down by other fans. Throughout the thread, many Black Myth: Wukong players shared their frustration with invisible walls, a complaint that has come up often in criticism of the game. There was plenty of agreement about the sentiment of Chapter 3, with one player describing it as "a ridiculous downgrade from the first 2 which were goty material."

It's important to remember that Black Myth: Wukong is Game Science's first title of this scale. Its last title, Art of War: Red Tides , was a strategy game made for both PC and mobile, so Black Myth: Wukong is sure to have been a big lesson in many areas of game design. A recent rumor suggests that Black Myth: Wukong could have two DLCs on the way, so hopefully the studio is able to apply those lessons in the content to come.

item.title: Best Strategy Games Set In The Desert
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Desert settings are iconic in video games, from Dune to Kenshi, offering strategic challenges in a harsh environment.
  • Homeworld: Deserts Of Kharak comes with intense desert warfare with a mobile base mechanic and tactical challenges.
  • Dune: Imperium and Dune: Spice Wars offer immersive strategy experiences in the iconic Dune universe, each with unique gameplay loops.

The desert has made for an evocative setting across all kinds of media, from the expansive, mesmerizing desert environments of Lawrence Of Arabia , to the often-visited sands of Tatooine in Star Wars . However, it could be argued that no desert is quite as iconic - and as memorable - as that of Frank Herbert's Dune .

Deserts don't have to be based on pre-existing IPs to be successful, however, with indie developers such as Lo-Fi Games creating their own desert wasteland world with their game, Kenshi . From digital board games like Dune: Imperium to the desert planet of Kharak in the lesser-known Homeworld title, strategy fans are spoiled for choice when it comes to desert settings.

6 Desert Kingdoms

A Minimalist Indie RTS Set In The Desert

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2024
  • Developer(s): Markus Fink
  • Genre: RTS

This minimalist indie strategy game features charming pixel art and a desert setting that tasks players with skirmishing in procedurally generated maps. The game's mechanics are as minimal as the visuals, making its systems easy to learn and friendly to newcomers, though there is room to strategize throughout each match.

Desert Kingdoms is a low-budget affair and, despite its use of procedural generation, it features little in the way of replay value. However, it's a great low-effort strategy game for lunch breaks and short play sessions.

5 Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak

Immersive Desert Warfare With A Mobile Base

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2016
  • Developer(s): Blackbird Interactive
  • Genre: RTS

Although Homeworld: Deserts Of Kharak lacks the deep space combat that Homeworld is known for, its desert warfare is surprisingly intense and often strategic. The game's dusty environments and open-field combat encounters are frequently tactical and offer a solid challenge, with a mobile base that gives the gameplay a unique twist.

If the aforementioned mobile base is destroyed, the mission is lost, and this presents a unique challenge because the mobile base is also the player's main source of power. What's more, players also have to worry about the temperature of their base, as overheating can be dangerous and even lead to the base's destruction. It may not be as timeless as Relic Entertainment's flagship title, Homeworld , but Deserts Of Kharak offers immersive desert battles for fans of more grounded combat.

4 Kenshi

A Strategic Sandbox In A Desert Wasteland

This strategic sandbox gives players complete freedom to explore its unique, utterly strange, and wholly unforgiving world. Kenshi is a brutal game that's unafraid to treat the player unfairly and, as a result, it's a relatively inaccessible experience. However, this also works in the game's favor, offering a deeply immersive world that feels genuine.

In the game, players control one or several adventurers attempting to make their way in a world that mostly comprises desert wastelands. Combat can be avoided, but players will often find themselves in fight-or-flight situations. Encounters make use of auto-attacks, but players are able to micromanage their squad members to increase their effectiveness, and the real-time-with-pause gameplay makes this relatively painless.

3 Starship Troopers: Terran Command

Fighting Alien Arachnids On A Desert Planet

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2022
  • Developer(s): The Artistocrats
  • Genre: RTS

Lacking the deep base-building mechanics and economic management that real-time strategy games are known for, Starship Troopers: Terran Command makes up for its simplicity with high-octane combat encounters that have players commanding large squads of zealous marines against hordes of alien arachnids. The game takes place in the iconic setting of Paul Verhoeven's film, Starship Troopers , and manages to stay relatively loyal to the source material.

For fans of action-orientated strategy games that enjoy fussing over the positioning of their units, Starship Troopers: Terran Command is likely to please. However, veteran RTS players may be somewhat disappointed by the game's lack of deeper systems.

2 Dune: Imperium

A Digital Board Game Set In The Dune Universe

  • Platform(s): PC, Xbox
  • Released: 2024
  • Developer(s): Dire Wolf
  • Genre: Strategy

This digital adaptation of the tabletop game of the same name is a turn-based strategy game with solid AI opponents and a great deal of variety. Dune: Imperium combines elements of popular board game mechanics such as worker placement and deck-building, offering a truly unique gameplay loop that tickles the brain in a number of ways.

Dune: Imperiu m is dense with strategic options, but its tutorial does an admirable job of easing players into the experience. The game's community may be relatively small, but players who can't find a game easily can always battle against competent AI opponents. Dune: Imperium also features a variety of leaders that encourage their own play-styles, and the game's recently released DLC, Dune: Imperium - Rise Of Ix , adds even more replay value to the game.

1 Dune: Spice Wars

A 4X RTS Set On The Dusty Dunes Of Arrakis

Developed by Shiro Games, the very same team behind the Viking-themed RTS, Northgard , Dune: Spice Wars is a real-time 4X game set in Frank Herbert's iconic Dune universe. More specifically, Dune: Spice Wars takes place on Arrakis and features a slew of thematic mechanics and systems that take full advantage of the source material.

Dune: Spice Wars is an incredibly methodical and slow-burning strategy game that takes patience to learn and play, with a focus on tactical timing and positioning. The game also features a great deal of faction variety, allowing players to command everyone from the Fremen and the Atreides, all the way to a band of organized smugglers. Furthermore, Dune: Spice Wars features an array of victory conditions that allow for diverse play, offering plenty of opportunities for comebacks along the way.
